page.title: 19PARKING
page.content: VEHICLE PARKING IS A REAL PROBLEM IN GALASHIELS AS THE STREETS WERE NOT BUILT TO ACCOMMODATE THE PRESENT VOLUME OF TRAFFIC. IN THE CENTRE OF THE TOWN THERE ARE MANY DOUBLE YELLOW LINE AREAS WHERE PARKING IS FORBIDDEN AT ALL TIMES. IN OTHER PARTS THERE IS'LIMITED PARKING' WHERE VEHICLES MAY ONLY STAY FOR A MAXIMUM OF 20 MINUTES. TRAFFIC WARDENS ARE ON PATROL THROUGHOUT THE DAY. SEVERAL OF THE LARGER SHOPS HAVE THEIR OWN CUSTOMER PARKING AREAS.THESE ARE PARTICULARLY NECESSARY NOWADAYS AS MANY FAMILIES SHOP ONLY ONCE EACH WEEK SO THEY LIKE TO WHEEL THE SHOPPING TROLLEY RIGHT TO THE CAR AND LOAD THE CONTENTS DIRECTLY INTO THE BOOT. BOTH CHANNEL AND BANK STREET ARE ONE WAY STREETS FOR TRAFFIC AND PARKING IS PERMITTED ON ONE SIDE ONLY.EVEN WITH THIS THE STREETS ARE QUITE NARROW.
